Reviews.Title: WOW!  ''''''' Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv to bring with me to college, and I must say that I am extremely happy with this purchase!  The screen is pretty vibrant and beautiful.  The TV itself is aesthetically pleasing as well, being very stylish with the bottom speakers.  It's also so incredibly thin!The TV: 22in LED LCD HDTV, for $200 had me sold! There is great value with this television.  I use it as a second monitor via HDMI cables, play computer games with it, and have plugged console games into it as well, and  everything looks as crisp and nice as other TVs.The volume, channel, etc buttons are on the right side of the tv, and they work well and are unintrusive.However, I admit that the speakers are sub-par to other televisions.  Although you shouldn't expect bose quality sound performance, the quality of the speakers are comparable to decent laptop speakers, but louder of course.  However, this could easily be remedied by plugging in a cheap $20 pair of external speakers if sound quality is of any importance to you.I've also noticed is that when viewed from below, the screen becomes somewhat dark!  So customers who wish to mount this tv high should be warned! However, the view from above, and sides are somewhat fine.Aside from the sound quality and slight view darkening, there aren't many gripes that I have with this TV. The value is astonishing, and it just looks great in general.  The TV comes in a box with a handle, so it doubles as a carrying case.  Included is also a remote, which functions fine and looks pretty cool, as well as a microfiber[?] cloth to wipe your screen with.All in all, I am sincerely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Worth a serious look. 1080p, great detail and fair audio, but room for improvement.,
Reviews.Author: videobruce
Reviews.Content: After talking to Vizio to try to get a handle on their multitude of model numbers (they seem to have more TV's than HP has printers), at least with the "E" and the "M" versions, they are the same set, just meant to be sold in different markets. The 220VA (both sets) will apply to this review.I had a chance to do a side by side with a Samsung 22" 1080 set (B2230HD) and to my surprise, this Vizio surpassed the Sammy in the detail department. Very noticeable when looking close up at faces or any other fine detail.The Sammy looked 'rolled off', soft compared to this. This is with the detail turned off (down to zero) on this set due to the excessive edginess to the image.Pros;1 1080p panel (most small sets under 32" are 720's). Advantage: computer monitor,2. Excellent fine detail compared to a equivalent Samsung model,2. Better audio than most (though that might not be saying much) as long as the SRS features are OFF. Due to the larger area below the panel, larger speakers (1"x 3" ovals) are apparently used (see below),3. Separate component and composite inputs. (many sets combine both, you can only use one or the other),4. Direct input entry for many (not all) inputs: TV, composite, component & HDMI. The 2nd HDMI input takes a second press of that button (The VGA & USB input are only through the 'Input' button),4. USB input for some media types,5. Very low power consumption. 13 to 24 watts depending on backlight setting,6. Headphone jack with adjustable bass & treble (some sets defeat the adjustments when using headphones). Can power up small bookshelve speakers, but with very low output. Running 4 ohm speakers might make enough difference,7. Decent image quality (with sharpness set to zero and 'idiot' gimmicks turned off),8, Ambient light sensor seems to work ok,9. VGA input works fine for a computer monitor (HDMI does not, see below),10. Ability to add channels they were not in the original scan but, only one memory; OTA or CATV not both (as with most sets),11. Ability to custom edit the input and station names (& call letters). Not just set choices, but almost anything you want,12 Base (not really a stand) can be left on if wall mounting since it isn't visible from the front and doesn't protrude out the back very far.Cons;1. The supplied 'base' (not really a 'stand') is a 'mother' to insert into the bottom of the panel. Extra force is needed to slide it into the mating 'tabs'. It's obvious this is a source of problems and many complaints here,2. There is no separate 'enter' button for channel entry. One has to just press the desired number and wait three seconds for the tuner to change channels. This is annoying!,3. If the channel was not in the 'master channel list', you can't access it by direct entry. There is a 'add channel' scan though,4. It takes FIVE button presses just to access the buried picture controls! Something that should not be more than one or two presses, takes five,5. HDMI is unsuitable for a PC input. Best one can do is using 1776x1000 to achieve 1:1 pixel mapping (just scan) with a 1" border around the desktop. Using any of the 'zoom' modes to 'fill' the screen destroys the mapping. The VGA has no problem and produces excellent text.6. 'Custom' picture settings are global. Set them for one input and all others have the same settings,7. Anything other than the 'Custom' setting, all the other picture modes have no adjustments available. Contrast, brightness, color, tint etc. are only available under 'Custom'. Really limits you here since other inputs may need different 'tweaking',8. Set powers down after a very short period of time with no input signal present; two minutes. A huge problem for PC use. When the computer goes to sleep or standby, the set shuts off. When you wake the PC, the TV doesn't sense the signal. You have to reboot the PC for the set to recognize the signal,9. Audio is fair. Far better than many, but still not up to the PQ level. The 'gimmicks' are a problem. SRS causes audio issues depending on the material. Leave both off!10. Remote leaves alot to be desired,11. Rear/side mounted panel controls. Hard to find, read & operate.The biggest outstanding issues are that base for the panel, picture settings, set shutting off too quickly, channel access, side/rear mounted controls and improving the audio.

Reviews.Title: Brand new model 1080p 22 Inch HD TV and it looks sharp!
Reviews.Author: Scott Felten
Reviews.Content: Just picked up one of these new VIZIO's and I really like it! The 1080p picture is crisp, and the sound is great. I tried another 32 Inch VIZIO and hated it, plus it threw out a ton of heat. This tiny VIZIO is razor thin, yet provides a full bright picture and does not get hot. It hits 125 degrees out here, and I just fried my old Dell. Just as well, it got red hot, wasn't 1080p, but swiveled and adjusted. I resent these newer cheaper TV's don't offer this feature. The optimum viewing angle for me is off a little, however the previous Phillips 22 Inch HDTV I just returned turned into a negative if you weren't sitting directly in front of it. 200 glowing reviews here so I bought it and thought it looked worse than a 70's TV. Thank you Amazon for your excellent free 30 day return policy too. Since this is a new unit not even available for sale at the VIZIO site yet ("coming soon"), it is hard to compare pricing or reviews. However you can't go wrong with this Model. Also I would like to thank Amazon for the unusual quick 2 day processing and delivery, even with the free super saver shipping. I've waited as long for a confirmation email!

Reviews.Title: Great for kitchen or bedroom
Reviews.Author: TL "Tom"
Reviews.Content: First of all, I did not buy this from Amazon or one of it affiliates. When our bedroom TV croaked, I went to Amazon first to check prices on several 22" TVs. Then Costco. But, since we were heading to town I figured I'd check Walmart which was right on our route. We found this exact TV model for over $55 LESS than the Amazon affiliate vendor. I often get the best deal on Amazon, but not this time.This is a fine small TV for a kitchen or bedroom. Clear and crisp picture. Lots of input/output options. Sharp looking. Front facing speakers are pretty good for a small TV.... not great sound, but what do you expect from a small package. The volume is better than our previous TV which had to be turned up all the way when used off the satellite... this one 75% volume is adequate without distortion.Setup was quick except I was a bit klutzy snapping in the base. But, once installed, the TV is very stable. I like the fact that the stand doesn't have a tall neck like our old one, keeps the TV flat on the table. The channel scan and other setup features worked perfectly. The only thing I don't especially like is the glossy trim about 1 inch wide around the edges... it reflects light from the windows and room. The matte screen handles reflections well.So this time, I am thankful for the info and reviews on Amazon, but very glad I didn't click the "add to cart" button too quickly.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: JO PA appreciates amazon
Reviews.Content: I desperately needed a second monitor for my work laptop, its pretty difficult only using one screen. So after doing research online, and coming to conclusion. I decided to purchase this product, so far it has treated me well. Fairly light to lift, very easy setup wizard. All in all I rate this a 5, it met my needs. Keeps cool, stand by mode, second screen :).

Reviews.Title: How top Install the Stand on a VIZIO E220VA 22 Inch TV
Reviews.Author: M. Kelson
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Costco and it seems to work very well. I downgraded it 1 star, however, because the stand is difficult to put on.To install the stand do the following:1. Lay the TV down on a table on a pillow or other soft surface.2. Scoot the top of the TV up against a wall so that it won't move when you push on the stand.3. Insert the two bottom clips of the stand into the matching holes on the TV and then swivel the stand up so it is flat against the bottom of the TV and lift slightly so that the rest of the clips go into the matching holes.4. Push the stand firmly against the TV, and strike the edge of the stand sharply with the palm of your hand or the soft part of your fist. If only one side of the stand goes in, then strike it again on the other side of the stand and then the other side will pop in also.

Reviews.Title: Neat little TV
Reviews.Author: Careful Consumer
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace the old one in the bedroom of our motorhome.  I love it!  Since there were only two reviews on this specific set when I bought it, I took a bit of a chance relying on the multitude of reviews of one of the earlier (sister) models...I think it was the M220.  The two big negatives for the small Razors were the darkening of the screen at viewing angles below straight on and the audio quality.Like the other similar models, this one does darken if you try to view it from below head on.  Maybe the back-lighting does not extend across the bottom of the screen...I wouldn't know.  For me it was not an issue, since I needed to rig a way to tilt the TV forward anyway so it could be comfortably watched from the bed.  I just added another 4 degrees of down angle to compensate for the backward tilt built in to the set when sitting on its base (oh, yes, the base is a bit difficult to get on, but follow the directions, be persistent, and it will snap into place snugly).  For those who want to use the TV in a location that places it higher than the viewer's eyes, consider spending $15 for a swivel wall mount.  This set is so light that any wall should support it easily.As for the audio, it was indeed pretty bad when I first turned the set on.  But a few minutes with the easy-to-use on-screen menus took care of that so well I changed my mind about getting some external speakers to go with it (and we like good sound with our movies).I love the features of this little set!  All the right connections, nicely organized.  Terrific picture, and an excellent owner's manual.  Read it!  You may be really surprised how quickly it answers all your questions and points out features you probably would never have dreamed this little TV could offer!  The remote is very nice, too!If I had not been prepared to deal with the viewing angle issue, I'm sure I would not have considered rating it higher than 4 stars.  Although we have not gotten a great deal of use out of this TV yet, we have been very pleased with it.  For what it's worth, it scans for channels fairly quickly (which is important when you're in a different broadcast area every couple of days), and we noticed that its tuner picked up probably two or three times more channels as our main TV using the same digital over-the-air antenna.

Reviews.Title: Excelent TV! (uhmmmm...)
Reviews.Author: Pedro Salinas
Reviews.Content: I was worried cause I brought this TV to Venezuela and wasn't going to have the chance to return it if something was wrong, but thankfully, EVERYTHING WAS GOOD! The image is awesome, really brigth colors, nice sound (not spectacular), and it's not as little as I thougth... For under 200$ it was the best option, sorry they already made it more expensive!UPDATE: The sound is awful... I think it's broken or something because it sounds just like a cheap speaker when you turn the volume on. I'll buy a Vizio SoundBar to improve the sound, hopefully it'll work and there won't be any compatibility issue.

Reviews.Title: Vizio will NOT Back Their Products; Too Profit Oriented
Reviews.Author: TorinsDad
Reviews.Content: To Whomever May be Interested: I purchased a Vizio Razor that ended up with what I understand is a far-too-common problem with the power supply.The problem surfaced one year and one month after I purchased it; meaning the warranty had expired. The power light indicator would come on but there were no other signs of life in the television. I researched the internet and found that it is a common problem with these TV's. I applied the suggested power button reset procedure and it did work -- once. It worked fine for the first few days after the procedure, then the original problem of lifelessness returned (and stayed with me).I called the company about the issue and was assisted by a lovely and very professional representative. I was told, however, that the procedure I implemented was the only solution she would have recommended. Additionally, I was told that, since the warranty had expired, Vizio has a "Tough Poopie" policy because the TV's they make are very technically complex pieces of equipment and these things happen.In all fairness to the company, I do have the exact same television in another room and it works very well. I would have liked to have seen the company provide me with at least *something* other than "you are on your own" after having spent in excess of $200.00 of my money on a product that should have lasted 10 years but only gave me one year of service for my investment. I am unlikely to buy and certainly will not recommend Vizio to anyone. Our society seems to be plummeting into an abyssmal "WalMart Economy" where people are not important and making more money governs all.....but I digress....If Vizio wants to redeem themselves (a replacement TV would be acceptable) I would be happy to remove this review and the others I have posted throughout the internet. My case number is 3120680.For what it is worth.....

Reviews.Title: Read me!
Reviews.Author: alaskahad
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to play movies for my kids and to game on. The tv is awesome! It has great picture and the sound is good. When I would game I could zone everything else out which does not happen very often with two little kids. After about 75 hours of use about 4 months the tv just would not turn on anymore. The light was on but the tv had no picture or sound (the only two things I expect in a tv) I called to get it repaired or replaced and vizio would not. I was still under warranty and nothing had been done to it. They vizio just decided that I was not worth being their customer anymore. I also have another vizio tv and have family that have bought vizio. Needless to say no more vizio for me or my family members. They lost three new tv customers and a large tv purchase for this decision. So just do not buy this vizio unless you want to pay to use it for 4 months or less and than not get it repaired or replaced.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture & decent sound!
Reviews.Author: Victor H. Agresti "remodeling-guy"
Reviews.Content: VIZIO EM220VA HDTVBased on online and in-store research of  22"-24" HDTV's, the VIZIO EM220VA appears to be the only LED TV of this size with decent audio. Most have a really good picture, but pathetic audio.  RCA's 24" LED24A45RQ, sold be Sears, is typical - great picture, but sounds like a tiny radio in a tin can, with treble on max.Vizio Razor's are the only TVs in this size range with speakers facing forward (they are beneath the screen).  It's not high fidelity, but there's plenty of volume, it's realistic sounding, and perfectly satisfactory.I ordered an EM220VA and a 3-year warranty from Walmart's web site and picked it up at the store 3 hours later.  With sales tax, it still cost $55 less than just the TV from Amazon.The instructions don't cover attaching the stand to the TVs bottom.  Here's how: lay the TV on it's face, align the stand tabs with the TV's receiving slots, press it against TV, and whack the back of the stand with the palm of your hand to snap it in place.  The TV is stable when on the stand, but it leans back at a fixed 5 degree angle; i.e., it's not adjustable.  The stand adds nothing to the TVs height.I mounted our Vizio on a terrific full motion TV wall mount, the Telehook Swing Arm Mount.  The mounting base-plate pivots forward & backward, and rotates 360 degrees to achieve virtually any viewing angle.  For wall mounting, the VIZIO E220VA has VESA (Video Electronics Standards Association) mounting holes in a 75 MM x 75MM (square) pattern.  I.e., 3" x 3" on center.With its very good picture and decent sound, this is a great little TV...

Reviews.Title: Great Price for an Excellent TV/Monitor
Reviews.Author: rodneygranell
Reviews.Content: Hi Decided to purchase this TV/Monitor when my home office LCD died a few weeks ago. I wanted to have a monitor that could receive TV signal as well and Amazon had the right product way below the price than other retailers. Item arrived fast and well packed.The clarity of the image in this LCD is awesome, I use this monitor to expand my laptop screen when docked; this allows me to work with several documents simultaneously. My wife loves how thin this LED TV is and when not using it for the computer it can be used to watch tv. I will definitively recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Works Well Enough
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: The price was right and it arrived 2nd day via Prime.  It was easy to unpack and set up.  Getting the stand attached takes a little faith and a good snap. On screen displays are logical and easy to use.  As others have noted the picture darkens if the TV is higher than your head and unfortunately the TV does not swivel on its stand to adjust, although it can be connected to a standard TV mount.  The audio is OK for a bedroom TV.  It is light and thin, does not get hot, and sits sturdy so I don't worry about it falling off the dresser.  I only drive it with my cable box which supports 1080i and it works fine at that.  Order an HDMI cable with the TV so that you can set it up without a trip to the hardware store.

Reviews.Title: I recommend it!
Reviews.Author: Trevor
Reviews.Content: Great TV! The picture is amazing and there are enough inputs for a lot of entertainment options. Perfect for dorm or office.

Reviews.Title: Dead after 8 months
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off saying this tv was great while it worked. I bought it for my daughter as a christmas present. I purchased it from walmart and added their extended warranty plan. It stopped working yesterday. I tried to turn it on with the remote and the power button on the side and nothing, I've tried plugging it in to outlets in different rooms and nothing, no signs of life. I contacted Walmart and they told me I would need to contact vizio customer service. I contacted them gave them info on the tv, they asked me if i kept the original box for the tv, I told the guy after 7 months no the box is gone. He told me vizio would have one shipped to me, then I could ship the tv to California (I live on the east coast) to their repair depot, of course I have to pay the shipping. I asked how long would I be looking at for this tv to be repaired, Around 27 days from contacting vizio to getting my tv back. Now the tv was great up until now, I had read reviews on it before buying and I did know there were several low ratings for this exact problem, but i decided to go ahead and get it. I would have put this review on Walmarts site but they no longer sale this tv. To wrap things up I would tell anyone interested in a vizio tv to stay away, I understand that electronic items are not perfect no matter who manufactures them but the way they handle a repair is lousy in my opinon, not to mention this defect is common to this tv. I also would tell people not to buy an extended warranty from walmart, they dont handle anything in store so it a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Great little T.V
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: This TV makes a great little TV for in the bed room.  It is very thin and easy to mount or rest almost anywhere.Only loses one star because I mounted it higher up in the corner of my bedroom. I had to lower it because the T.V looks too dark when viewed from a lower angle.Over all a great T.V for the price!

Reviews.Title: Vizio 22
Reviews.Author: Glen R. Fotre "glenf"
Reviews.Content: I paid $198 last week at Wally World! Why is it so much more expensive on Amazon?? It just doesn't make any sense to me.

Reviews.Title: great cheap full 1080p tv
Reviews.Author: Philip Marquis
Reviews.Content: i bought this tv from walmart priced at $198its a fantastic tv the only thing i dont like is it dose not haves-videoi would recommend this tv to other and would buy againthis is a perfect tv for those who DONT want a billboard

Reviews.Title: was great...for 60 days
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Loved this TV. Great features for great price. Had everything we were looking for. Then one day when we turned it on, we get a power indicator but nothing, no menus, no sounds, no screen..just nothing but a power indicator. DO NOT BUY THIS

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Debra Klingsporn
Reviews.Content: I bought the Vizio after looking at many different brands and models. Was looking for a small footprint for our kitchen/dining area and this one seemed the best option for one very simple reason... The Vizio brand still has speakers on the front of the TV and therefore works well as a stand-alone TV. All others would work great if I wanted to hook the TV into a sound system, meaning the speakers' sound came from the back of the unit. The sound quality of this TV is great without having to hook up additional speakers. Really glad I bought this one.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Edwin Weber
Reviews.Content: Although I purchased the Vizio 19-inch TV, my comments about the instructions will probably apply to the 20 and 22 inch versions as well. Only the Quick Start Guide is included in the box, I suggest that you go to the Vizio web site and download the full User Manual at [...].  The same User Manual is used for all three sizes. The User Manual contains much valuable information but, with 45 pages, you might want to print only certain pages.  Many people have had problems installing the base.  The User Manual has much better directions with illustrations for installing the base than the Quick Start Guide.FYI, there are two audio output ports.  The green port on the back of the set will work only if the set is being used with a PC.  The second port is on the left side above the USB port. If you want to add headphones or external speakers,  the port of the side is the one to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Image
Reviews.Author: owen_colraine
Reviews.Content: As part of a TV studio I was contracted for I had to purchase many many flatscreens on a budget and wound up with several different brands. We chose Vizio only for the 22 inch tvs because some companies seem to have abandoned smaller tvs all together. Now I wish we'd purchased all our screens from Vizio. These little tvs have the most amazing image quality. When I put this image alongside the 2000 dollar sdi broadcast monitor (I was forced to buy just to have professional monitoring in the studio) the image looks the same--at ten times less money! If you don't need a giant screen and just want a reasonable addition to your dorm room, or study, or wherever, this TV is spectacular! Spectacular.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 22" HDTV
Reviews.Author: David L. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: the vizio tv is just what i wanted for small room. Picture is very good and sound is ok for what i need. It is hooked up to a hd cable box and the picture is better than our big tv. As everything i have ordered thru Amazon i am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Clear picture
Reviews.Author: Barbara C. Barker "Southern Cook"
Reviews.Content: Received the Vizio 22" LED LCD HDTV on time and it was very easy to set up.  The picture is very good and I was amazed at how little it weighted.  This is my first LED LCD TV and it really makes a difference, especially on live programs.  The Nascar races are great!  I would recommend this TV to anyone and would buy another when I need another TV.

Reviews.Title: Great flat screen
Reviews.Author: DeusEx
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I can't say enough about the value you get for the inexpensive TV.  It has an excellent picture and built in HD tuner.  It's light weight making it an excellent choice for wall mounting and (as in my case) under cabinet installations.  Honestley I do have three complaints.  #1) Like others I agree the internal speakers leave something to be desired.  I however intend to use this primarily with headphones.  The headphone jack puts out a low level hiss that is much less noticable at higher volumes but at points of silence can be heard.  #2) Visio doesn't include much in the way of an owner's manual...  Not a big deal unless you're not a techy or need to troubleshoot a problem.  #3) The two HDMI inputs are located directly beneath the VESA mounting holes so depending on the mount you intend to use (such as a 75-100mm Universal) you may find one or both unusable.  In my case, my mount is a swiveling pole mount with a 75-100mm plate which mostly obstructs the top HDMI port and somewhat blocks the second.  A 90 degree HDMI cord should solve this issue with the bottom port but will not with the top.

Reviews.Title: It's so nice, you'll buy it twice!
Reviews.Author: willwgp
Reviews.Content: I had a 32" Vizio and really liked it, but the HDMI ports were screwy and not functioning how they were supposed to due to old age. So I went on a search to buy one of these, and love it! The size is still very big! Great for movies, tv, computer, really whatever you want to do! The sound is nice! The quality is incredible! I loved the tv so much I bought a second one to use as a monitor at work, and it's very nice! Don't let this tv walk away!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Diane Cate "graymane"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this compact model for our RV.  It is just the perfect size for the bedroom wall and provides clear viewing enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: * Rocky Top Boys *
Reviews.Content: I had previously bought the Vizio 20in TV for the kitchen and absoultely loved it. Unfortunately, our house was burglarized and this TV was taken. I was so pleased with the original I decided to purchase this 22in and could not be happier. Great size, great color and great sound...perfect for the kitchen!

Reviews.Title: Good Value, Great for Kitchen
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: After our kitchen remodeling was completed, we began looking for a new counter sitting TV. There are many brands and styles of 13 to 22 inch TV's. We chose this Vizio because of its design of sitting flat on the counter that maximizes the size of screen that can be used underneath a standard counter to cabinet dimension of 16 inches. And, although, perhaps not a premium brand, Vizio is certainly well made and well suited for this type of use.

Reviews.Title: Why I purchased this TV
Reviews.Author: whispering eagle
Reviews.Content: Why I purchased this TV!I would like to start off by saying that the name VIZIO is one reason. I have a Vizio 47" in my living room and this 22" in my bedroom. The picture is great as well as the sound. I had purchased a Westinghouse a couple years back and had to stand right by it to hear anything. As the name says...We sting ho use...After that, I purchased a VIZIO (221model) 22" Razor led lcd tv. I found out that you don't lay it down in the back seat of your car and drive down the road...I broke the lcd when it bounched on the seatbelt connection. ($228 down the drain) These LED LCD's are very fragile. Handle with care..This is the one I purchased to replace that one.

Reviews.Title: How do I love thee, Vizio TV? Let me count the ways....
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an ancient 19" tv in my bedroom. I purchased it "used/like new" here on Amazon from an amazing seller and wow, how I love this TV!!!I've been using it for over a week now. Sleek, stylish, lightweight and the picture quality is *fantastic*!!!! I was using the apt building's rooftop HD antenna and ugh how miserable that was. I refuse to pay some horrid cable company 22+ bucks just for reception. So I hooked a Philips antenna up to this tv instead of using the rooftop and am thrilled with the combination.This TV is so easy to set up that even an electronics manuals hater like me was able to do it in a few minutes. Some complain about the remote but I love this remote! The buttons make sense, are placed sensibly and after an hour I was able to do all I needed to do with the remote by touch only. Unlike my last old old old tv's remote that had a hundred buttons that I never did figure out or use.The screen menu to set up inputs, channel scans, color, tint, etc are wonderfully simple and elegant. Finally, something made well and that's simple to use.Absolutely fabulous! So glad I took my time looking around before purchasing. Appreciate all the reviews here which definitely did sway me. Have recommended this brand to my daughter who will be replacing her large tv soon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: D. A. Grabowski "Portia"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to put into the new addition to my kitchen, it is wonderful. Sometimes the picture is somewhat distorted on the smaller flat screen TVs, but not on this one. It has lots of features HDTV, HDMI, dolby, and is a Edge Lit Razor LED LCD. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Best small TV
Reviews.Author: JIM G. CO
Reviews.Content: I shopped around the local retailers and discounters and couldn't find a better bargain. Because I'm a "Prime" member the deal was even sweeter because of the "2-day free shipping". But in regards to the VIZIO HDTV, it has a great picture and sound. I bought it for our kitchen and found that we are spending more time watching TV in the kitchen even though we have a larger HDTV in the living room. Had a house-full of guests last Saturday and received many positive comments. "How can a TV of that size have such a great picture"?.Great buy, great delivery, very happy. Never been disappointed with AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: great machine, low price
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson "Sumner31"
Reviews.Content: We've been living with a 13 inch television in our bedroom since 1989 but since the set couldn't keep up with technology we decided it was time to buy.  I usually search online before going to stores so when this set popped up on Amazon.com we decided we couldn't beat the price.  We ordered it on a Thursday and got it the next day.  The set was great but because it was HD and our box wasn't we had to call our server.  As luck would have it, we were entitled to a free HD box which we quickly ordered.  It took 3 days to get it.  We called our satellite service and they helped us connect it.Outstanding television! Contrary to the review the sound is fine.  It was easy to hook up, very stylish and easily movable.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV all the way around
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Lenard
Reviews.Content: I picked up this unit to replace a 13" old-school TV that was hanging in my basement bar.  I have been on a mission to rid my house of all of the old-school tube TVs and in the process I have picked up three Vizio models... a 22", a 37" and a 55".  They're all great.  I hung this in the corner of the bar area with one of the VideoSecu articulating arms and it worked out perfectly.  The holes in the back of the TV aligned with one of the sets of holes in the bracket and the bracket angles in all directions and let's me slightly angle the TV downward.  Otherwise, this Vizio is everything I expected... sleek and slim, great picture, lots of video and audio options (I turned off the surrounds and equalizer and boosted the bass to give the tinny-sounding speakers the most oomph.  It's not a great sound but it's okay.  It's hooked to a Comcast HD box and the picture is outstanding.  I got the TV, the bracket and an HDMI cable for under $225... you just can't beat it.  Oh, and the yellow ENERGY tag on the TV said it would cost $5 a year to run it!  Sweet.  I highly recommend this product for any small areas like a kitchen, master bathroom, small bedroom, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Graff
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small tv to go with our treadmill and this has really fit the bill! The setup was very fast and easy. We mounted ours on the wall so I assume it would be even faster if it was going on a table top or something.Overall, very happy with this tv. It was exactly what we were looking for, and a price we were willing to pay.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 22 inch Class Edge Lit Razor LED LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Karen Halloran
Reviews.Content: Purchased as gift for son's room which is working out perfectly.  Great picture, easy to mount on wall, just a perfect gift for a 17 year old!  I recommend this TV if you are looking for something affordable, quality and current.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight and perfect picture
Reviews.Author: Woody1
Reviews.Content: Wow, this TV was like paper-thin and packed with features. If you have never owned a VIZIO, then you are missing out.  This was perfect for my daughters apartment bedroom.  Has lots of features and the price could not be beat for the quality.  You know VIZIO has a zero pixel defect, right?  4th Vizio and still not a dead pixel or a bright pixel either. I would buy again. LED is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Harranath1
Reviews.Content: This TV does the job and for the price, it is hard to beat. I use it almost exclusively to play video games and watch my netflix via xbox and it works perfectly for my small, 10'x12' room. I'd probably opt for the 32" if I had a bigger space but this is a perfect bedroom or dorm tv.

Reviews.Title: Great for a computer monitor!
Reviews.Author: sebastian
Reviews.Content: Size is perfect for my small corner desk!  Price range very good for my intended use.It is extremely thin, another asset for the area of usage.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Just bought this T.V. Vizio 22inch. The best I've ever owned for it's size. Perfect for my apartment. Flawless, perfect picture. Very, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Kenesha H
Reviews.Content: I love it! =] I couldnt be happier. Everything it says it is, it is. I wouldnt trade it for the world and its nice , good picture, good quality

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: James Kice "J Wh0le"
Reviews.Content: looked brand new, minus the box looking like it had been in a bomb shelter for the last 70 years. tv works great, definitely got my moneys worth

Reviews.Title: The TV is great.
Reviews.Author: Pat Stevens
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old TV with this flat screen.  Now, because I like this TV I bought for my kitchen so much, I'm really disappointed with the quality of my other TV's.  Amazon has been great with all the orders I have placed, but now I have to look for a flat screen for my bedroom.  I'll get back to you when I figure out how large I want for my bedroom.Thank youPat

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV FROM ANY ONE!
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: Seven months into ownership it would only turn on sometimes.  This after unplugging from outlet.  Visio had me try a reset by holding power button after it is unplugged.  Turns out it is only warranted for 30 days by ECost and not at all from Visio because ECost is not an authorized reseller.  It is too bad because I have bought numerous other electronics from ECost, this is the first time I have gotten burned.  DO NOT BUY THIS TV FROM ANY ONE!  Research now shows that this is a known problem!

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: unhappy
Reviews.Content: Had this tv for a little over 6 months. It started to flicker and look like there were tw o diff. pictures at the same time. Shortly after that it went completely dead.It has not even been a year and VIZIO is being a pain about fixing it

Reviews.Title: Fine TV, Warning on the Wall Mount!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Playnoevil"
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is fine.However. I wanted to mount it on the wall and picked up the Cheetah wall mount that Amazon suggested.BIG MISTAKE.The Cheetah mount is fine. It has the standard "butterfly" type universal VESA connection for attaching to the TV.The connector fits.But, the overall connection on the Cheetah (and many other wall mounts) covers all but the coax connector on the TV.No HDMI.No component cable.Nothing.Stupid.These wall mount connectors are quite standard. That VIZIO didn't consider this was just dumb. Especially for this size TV.So, OK TV, but be real careful if you are going to mount it on a wall (I think the connection is the 100mm small square connector, but get the TV before you get the connector!).

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Mustufa Husain
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost a month and so far no complaints except the picture is not as clear as you would expect for a LED TV, but for the price i wouldn't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Nom De Plum
Reviews.Content: I have only had this TV three weeks.Let me tell you I love, love, love the aesthetic design of this set. Unfortunately it has been nothing but problems since day one. There is a photo mode on this TV which week one I accidentally went into and then when I went to change the input back to what I had it on the TV would only show in black in white. Fast forward two weeks later, my roommate figures out that you have to actually press the exit button to back out of the Photo Mode because otherwise the programming still thinks it is in that mode. The set has some sort of build in auto tuner for ambient lighting and the picture flickered so much that I had to turn this feature off. In fact I turned all of these features off and it still flickers (just not as bad). I contacted Vizio because I bought it directly from them and they would not help me via email. They said that I had to call customer service. Well yeah right. From the horror stories I have read online, no thanks. I have it to a point where its watchable and the flickering is only a minor annoyance but for a tv that's only three weeks old this is pretty much unacceptable. Word to the wise, don't buy from Vizio; this company is no longer what it was.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Pinja
Reviews.Content: Love it!For a 22 in, this Vizio.Sound: 10Video: Cable - 7 ( I am sure satellite tv would look better especially HD)Gaming: 10Movie: 10Screen is perfect for a dorm room. Very light and thin.Absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor
Reviews.Author: Douglas O
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a good monitor.  The colors are vibrant, and the refresh rate seems very fast.  The 3D is pretty cool for some things, not so much for others.  I tried using the 3D mode for BF3, and it was hard on my eyes - ended up with a headach.  But...some say you get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Not compatible with Roku
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Morris
Reviews.Content: I was going to use this tv for my new Roku3. This would be wall mounted in front of my exercise machine so I could watch movies or whatever while I exercised thus passing the time away. Well low and behold when I tried to play video content from the Roku on to this tv the error message popped up.... HDCP Unauthorized. Content disabled. I could see the Roku screen but when I tried to play video the error message appeared even though I could here the content beautifully. Yet the Roku 3 worked perfectly on two different panasonics and a Viewsonic. But i tried three different hdmi cables. I called customer support at Roku. After two hours we concluded it was the vizio model. I called customer support at Vizio and spoke with Kayla and she told me that all vizios would work and it was a Roku problem. Pass the buck. I am convinced it is this particular model of vizio E220VA. By the way the Roku people were great. The Vizio gal got upset and was glad to be rid of me.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Chuck Rohr
Reviews.Content: I built a swivel and enclosed sealed container for my dock. Much humidity and great sound, reverberating from encloser.Holding up well. Thank you.Chuck Rohr

Reviews.Title: Outstanding HDTV, great value!

Love the remote! Simple, but intuitive. Purchased this LED HDTV as a manufacturer refurb, and would do it again. An outstanding value.

Reviews.Content: Works, good enough for the kitchen, warm up time is long, volume is low, wife likes it . Works, good enough for the kitchen, warm up time is long, volume is low, wife likes it .

Reviews.Title: Great Picture

Reviews.Title: great television for the bedroom

The picture quality couldn't be better as well as the sound. Some days it's hard to pull myself away from watching it.Overall, I am very happy with this product.

Reviews.Author: J. Gagliano
Reviews.Content: bought this tv last summer after my sister "took over" at my house. got a great deal on it also. from initial set up i loved the set. perfect size for my room was my initial thought and it still sits to this day. only concern is that from not even 10 feet i feel as if i can hardly make detail on it. i dont know could just be me ive had this problem at 30ft with a 46in. i have bad eyes but i have glasses. personally i like this unit i feel it does the job its supposed to. at night however you can see the backlight on the screen its very annoying. easy fix...turn down the backlight. for best picture take a look at generic settings for a tv...very helpful if you feel your picture doesnt look right. i have ho problems with this at all. i actually have it hooked up on a dual mount bought from amazon...amazing mount and cheap fits perfectly. if any questions feel free to respond to this review. more reviews on products soon to come

Reviews.Content: all I can say is I love it. The first flat screen I have owned and it is a wonder

Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Content: love the clarity and easy set up and use of this t.v.  would recommend it to anyone who is looking for this size of t.v.

Reviews.Content: great look, decent performance for the price feature less led tv. the picture will not "WOW" you but it is perfect for a second tv.

Reviews.Content: I use this as a second monitor for my Mac computers.  It works great.  I got one from Amazon to make sure I liked it.  I needed another 3, but when I went to order them 2 weeks later, the price had gone up by $80.  So shop around.  I did!

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: Stelly46
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at the picture sharpness. It came on time and is the perfect size for the top of the table in the bed room.

Reviews.Title: Good Value, Good TV
Reviews.Author: Newf Person "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: I own another Vizio TV, but misplaced the power cord in a move. It's since been found and I will eventually have it installed in the living room. In the meantime, the latest Vizio is functioning well with the sharp HDTV picture my TV programming provider promised.As usual, Amazon had a very good price and its delivery was prompt.This is an ideal TV for a bedroom or a dorm room.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: This 22in Vizio LED tv is great. Picture is great and didn't have any problems using it as a monitor for laptop either. The speaker also puts out great sound.

Reviews.Title: Good t.v.

Reviews.Content: We wanted a small t.v. for our bedroom to watch occasionally.  The picture is nice and the sound comes across really well.  It is a good price for the size of the t.v.

Reviews.Title: Good Kitchen TV

Reviews.Content: If your looking for a TV for your kitchen this is a great size TV.  We were concerned with the picture quality since it was going to be mounted on the wall allowing us to observe it from the kitchen table.  No problem!! Setup was quick and simple and if my husband and I can do it anyone can, trust me!  Good buy! Only reason we didn't rate it a 5, is because nothing is ever perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great Television!
Reviews.Author: Fate
Reviews.Content: Personally, I wall mounted this on a swivel arm for gaming. The picture quality is *GREAT* Better than any comparable 1080p models I've seen in this price/size range. The unit itself is quite thin, and light. I'm beyond impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!!!
Reviews.Author: dwave
Reviews.Content: This TV/Monitor is all the ad says it is, and for a great price to boot.  Vivid color, 1080P, sleek...  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Great...until it dies
Reviews.Author: md_KG
Reviews.Content: This TV was very simple to set up even with the funky base which can make it look like it's about to tip over if you touch it but once I got it to sit, it was pretty sturdy (provided it's put somewhere that it can't be knocked over easily). Tuning it was a breeze and the image quality was really good. The volume and sound could be improved but it was adequate enough. All that being said, my main gripe is why after 7 months this particular television will decide to die on its owner. I'm totally confused.I bought mine in December 2011 (from Walmart---I'm starting to think maybe all the defective units just happened to be shipped there because another reviewer had the same issue 8 months after purchasing this from there) and in late June of this year it stopped working. I tried to turn it on with the remote as well as the power button on the side but got no response. The situation is so bizarre.Also, the length of time that Vizio takes to resolve and repair the TV is unbelievably long. As at the time of writing this review, my TV is still in their repair depot despite them having received it since 7/2/2012 and all I keep hearing is conflicting messages from their customer service agents as to when it shall be repaired and shipped back. Had I known that other units were having this same issue I would have stayed away. After this experience, I highly doubt I'll ever buy a Vizio product again.**Update** 7/27/2012:After sending a couple of tweets to Vizio Support on 7/25/2012, whoever was tweeting from that account actually made the effort to contact the warehouse to get an update. My TV was finally shipped on 7/26/2012 and is scheduled to arrive on 2/8/2012. Bear in mind they've had it in their possession since 7/2/2012.Well, I'm finally getting my TV back so shouldn't I be happy? Not particularly, especially after I discovered that a few people had their repaired units break down a second time with the same issue. I'm completely dissatisfied with this product and I intend to get rid of the repaired unit as soon as possible.I would advise anyone considering buying this to stay away. Very. Far. Away.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO Razor 22" is a great 'small space' tv!!!
Reviews.Author: Dee M
Reviews.Content: Got the TV faster than promised (3 days).  Tried install myself, had it all hooked up according to instructions. TV didn't do what the manual said.  SO I CALLED COMCAST.  On the phone they had it installed as wired (HD has all those cables) in about 5 seconds!!!  It works beautifully.  Not a single glitch. The color and picture are excellent.  I use this tv in my office, and is about 9-10 feet away from my desk chair.  This 22" size is just right and the unit doesn't take up much room.  The stand is small/narrow but sturdy. Don't hesitate to purchase -- especially at this price.  I have had the tv about 6 weeks.

Reviews.Title: No Component Video Support
Reviews.Author: Dominic Cavalucci
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first E220VA from the Walmart web site and it installed easily and the picture and sound was great for an inexpensive small TV.  Where I ran into trouble is when I connected my dvd player to the Vizio with a video component  cable (red, blue green connectors) and found I could only display a black and white picture.  I contacted Vizio and after exploring all options I was told my unit was defected.  I returned it to Walmart for a refund and purchase the same model from Costco and installed it with the same result.  I again contacted Vizio and they wanted to replace or repair this unit.  I believe there is a design problem with this model.  I do get color if I use the connection on the side of this unit with a red, white and yellow RCA connection to the dvd player.  I'll live with this shortcoming since this is not a primary TV in the house.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Rosebud
Reviews.Content: This brand named TV has always been an excellent product for us. We have bought three sets now for two different locations. The picture is prefect, of course depending on what air waves you are using. LED is the best, clear, clear picture. You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: B. Veillon
Reviews.Content: We got this TV for the kitchen. We love it. It has a great picture. I like base of it, it is more stable than the ones on pedestals. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with The Vizio E220VA; especially considering the good reviews that this TV has received. Connected to a roof-top over-the-air antenna, the picture quality on the VIZIO does not come close to the quality of my Panasonic plasma TV.  In fact, the VIZIO picture was far inferior to that provided by an eight-year-old Panasonic in my office connected to rabbit-ears, as well as an ancient 15" Magnavox in the kitchen that this TV was purchased to replace.  After a couple of days of tweaking and adjusting, I finally threw in the towel.  Blacks and whites were rendered exceptionally, but I found it impossible to render the subtleties of faces and human skin realistically.  Also, I was unable to eliminate a pervasive graininess.  My suspicion is that the good reviews originate with owners who have cable, satellite, or fiber-optic sources, and that the VIZIO is unable to provide acceptable video using an over-the-air antenna.Based on my research, this Vizio and a discontinued Samsung were the only prospective candidates for a small (22" or less) TV that provides both decent video and audio.  Will now wait and hope that a capable new small TV eventually comes to market.

Reviews.Title: E220VA is an OK TV
Reviews.Author: Reztips
Reviews.Content: Received this TV very soon after purchase which was great.  Upon opening I discovered there was only a "quick start guide" and no full user manual.  Not a big deal, right?I attempted to install the base so that it could rest on my dresser.  BIG MISTAKE!  The base is really difficult to install.  The quick start guide didn't help at all and neither did the instructions online.  During my attempt at installation I snapped two plastic tabs off of the base.  I called Vizio customer service and was put through to a real, breathing, English speaking human in a very short amount of time (BONUS!).  She proceeded to tell me that this is a known design issue on these TVs.  She checked to see if I could get a new base.  I certainly could however Vizio wouldn't cover under warranty.  REALLY?!!  That's a bunch of bull.  She said it was my fault and not a manufacturing flaw (even though she said it is a known issue).  Fortunately there are several more tabs that are bigger and play a role in supporting the TV.  I was able to install the base and all was well.The picture and sound quality are good, not great.  All in all I got a good price on a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: What I do to improve my view of HDTV
Reviews.Author: Harold Hartley
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tv and I am using it as a monitor for my computer and to watch tv and for watching DVD's and play the wii on it too.But I learned after buying my first hdtv that you don't expect it to look as good as you see in the store. All hdtv's are setup to look great in the store, but when you get it home and you find that it doesn't look as good as it did in the store.I called a tv tech to come to my home and calibrate the tv so it looks great in my home setting.So over time I have told many people what I did and they did the same and they were a lot happier after doing so.So it's worth the extra money to get the best from a new or used hdtv.

Reviews.Title: happy customer
